poem:
"Small Cog in the Mechanical Hound"

Within the bureaucratic gears, a cog spins,
small, unassuming, echoing disclosures,
sculpting law in its steel-twisted mirror image.

In green Scotland, it murmurs:
A bully dog's bark, regulated,
replicated from the weight of London's ink.

Stricter chains tie nature's wild,
inked decree in civil tongue,
an echo of obedience,
the cog continues its spin.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Post Office investigator says he is ‘small cog’ over Horizon flaws disclosure – UK politics live 2.52pm GMT Yousaf says Scotland will 'in essence replicate' England's ban on having XL bully dogs without licence Humza Yousaf has said the Scottish government will “in essence replicate” UK legislation banning XL bully dogs without a licence, PA Media reports. Speaking in the Scottish parliament the first minister said: In England and Wales strict rules on the dogs". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Post Office investigator says he is ‘small cog’ over Horizon flaws disclosure – UK politics live 2.52pm GMT Yousaf says Scotland will 'in essence replicate' England's ban on having XL bully dogs without licence Humza Yousaf has said the Scottish government will “in essence replicate” UK legislation banning XL bully dogs without a licence, PA Media reports. Speaking in the Scottish parliament the first minister said: In England and Wales strict rules on the dogs
